results.title: Journalism Resource Tapes
results.brief_description: A series in which Creighton Burns, editor of “The Age” newspaper, and Harry Gordon, former editor-in-chief at “The Herald and Weekly Times” discuss various issues and aspects of journalism.

results.title: Journalism
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A straightforward account of a sometimes over-glamorised profession. The copy boy carries out menial tasks; the cadet learns how to report crime, general, parliamentary, financial and sporting news. The erratic hours of work are shown to apply to radio and television journalism as well as to newspaper work, and the basic demands of the work are similar.

results.title: Journal D'une Femme de Chambre = Diary of a Chambermaid (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Michel Safra and Serge Silberman
results.brief_description:
Celestine takes up a position as chambermaid in a middle-class family and becomes the catalyst that reveals their sexual, religious and social repressions. The film, foot fetishism and all, is pure Bunuel, a sharp social satire in which the sexy, cruel and cool Jeanne Moreau is wonderful. Jean Renoir directed a version of ‘Le journal d’une femme de chambre’ in 1934.

Credits: Producers, Serge Silberman, Michel Safra; director, Luis Bunuel ; writers, Luis Bunuel, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Roger Fellous ; art direction, Georges Wakhevitch.
Cast: Jeanne Moreau, Michel Piccoli, Francoise Lugagne, Georges Geret, Jean Geret, Daniel Ivernel, Gilberte Geniat, Muni, Dominique Sauvage, Jean-Claude Carriere, Jean Ozenne, Andree Tainsy.

results.title: Jour de fete [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Fred Orain and Francinex
results.brief_description: Jacques Tati’s award winning feature debut is an hilarious expose of the modern obsession with speed and efficiency, set amidst the rural surroundings of a tiny French village. The arrival of the summer fair brings a frenzy of activity as children, villagers and showmen bustle to cram as much as possible into twenty four fun-packed hours. But when the local postman attempts the high speed methods of the American mail service the villagers experience a new kind of madness. Also available on VHS [301871].

results.title: Josie and the pussycats [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Deborah Kaplan, Harry Elfont, Marc Platt, Chuck Grimes, Tracey E. Edmonds, Tony De Rosa-Grund, Riverdale Productions, Universal Pictures and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based on the Archie comic book series, this teen flick is an exuberant adaptation of the characters of Josie, Valerie and Melody who form a rock group and are catapulted to stardom overnight after being discovered by a talent scout. Unbeknownst to the girls however, the label they have signed with, MegaRecords, run by Fiona (Parker Posey, revelling in the role of arch-villainess), insert subaural messages into the music that brainwashes teenagers into buying an array of products, from shoes to deodorant. When the label pushes Josie as the main artist, diminishing the roles of Val and Mel, the girls’ friendship is threatened. This film successfully satirises teenage marketing, consumerism, product placement, all-boy bands, manufactured pop and teen movies but undermines its credibility by gratifying the teen wish-fulfillment fantasy. The gaudy palette is utilised to great effect from the costumes of the band to the ever-changing sets; and the self-reflexive pop references flow thick and fast throughout the script that oscillates between all-knowing cleverness and straight up pandering to mainstream culture. Ultimately the film cannot decide which side of the fence it sits on but remains an amusing, fun distraction. Cast includes Rachael Leigh Cook, Tara Reid, Rosario Dawson, Alan Cumming and Gabriel Mann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Deborah Kaplan, Harry Elfont, Marc Platt, Chuck Grimes, Tracey E. Edmonds, Tony De Rosa-Grund, Riverdale Productions, Universal Pictures and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: Josie and the Pussycats
results.creator_credit: Hanna-Barbera Productions, William Hanna and Joseph Barbera
results.brief_description: Josie and the Pussycats is an American animated television series, based upon the Archie Comics comic book series of the same name created by Dan DeCarlo.

constellations_other.name: Conflict to cartoons
constellations_other.description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Hanna-Barbera Productions, William Hanna and Joseph Barbera
results.description:
Josie and the Pussycats is an American animated television series, based upon the Archie Comics comic book series of the same name created by Dan DeCarlo. Produced for Saturday morning television by Hanna-Barbera Productions, sixteen episodes of Josie and the Pussycats aired on CBS during the 1970-71 television season, and were rerun during the 1971-72 season. In 1972, the show was re-conceptualized as Josie and the Pussycats in Outer Space, sixteen episodes of which aired on CBS during the 1972-73 season and were rerun the following season. Reruns of the original series alternated between CBS, ABC, and NBC from 1974 through 1976. This brought its national Saturday morning TV run on three networks to six years.

Josie and the Pussycats featured an all-girl pop music band that toured the world with their entourage, getting mixed up in strange adventures, spy capers, and mysteries. On the small-screen, the group consisted of level-headed lead singer and guitarist Josie, intelligent tambourinist Valerie, and air-headed blonde drummer Melody. Other characters included their cowardly manager Alexander Cabot III, his conniving sister Alexandra, her cat Sebastian, and muscular roadie Alan.
description_for_label:

In 1972, the show was re-conceptualized as Josie and the Pussycats in Outer Space, sixteen episodes of which aired on CBS during the 1972-73 season and were rerun the following season. Reruns of the original series alternated between CBS, ABC, and NBC from 1974 through 1976. This brought its national Saturday morning TV run on three networks to six years.

results.title: Josie and the Pussycats
results.creator_credit: Marc Platt Productions, Universal Pictures, Riverdale Productions, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jasna Stefanovic, Deborah Kaplan, Harry Elfont, Syd Dutton, Tony DeRosa-Grund, Leesa Evans, Marc Platt, Tracey E. Edmonds and Chuck Grimes
results.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2001
results.brief_description: Josie, Melody and Val are three small-town girl musicians determined to take their rock band out of their garage and straight to the top, while remaining true to their look, style and sound.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Marc Platt Productions, Universal Pictures, Riverdale Productions, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jasna Stefanovic, Deborah Kaplan, Harry Elfont, Syd Dutton, Tony DeRosa-Grund, Leesa Evans, Marc Platt, Tracey E. Edmonds and Chuck Grimes
results.description: Josie, Melody and Val are three small-town girl musicians determined to take their rock band out of their garage and straight to the top, while remaining true to their look, style and sound. They get a record deal which brings fame and fortune but soon realize they are pawns of two people who want to control the youth of America. They must clear their names, even if it means losing fame and fortune.

They must clear their names, even if it means losing fame and fortune.

results.title: Joshua in a box
results.creator_credit: John Lange and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: An animated film which uses the situation of a boy being trapped in a box as a basis for a study of needs, emotions and values. No commentary, music and sound effects only.

results.title: Joshua Cooks & Dragon
results.creator_credit: Lucy MacLaren, Penny Robenstone and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Through making a cake, a little boy gains some sense of independence and growth. Within this he struggles with fantasy versus reality to achieve an end product he can be proud of. Plus the story of two young girls who leave a dragon on a tram and go to the depot at night to find it.
